intro: Rubus stenopetalus subsp. emollitus, commonly known as the soft-petaled blackberry, is a shrub native to the southern United States. It is characterized by its slender, thornless stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that mature to a dark purple or black color.
